label: A2B3C12D3_cI160_230_a_c_h_d-001
title: Garnet [$S1_{4}$, Co$_{3}$Al$_{2}$(SiO$_{4}$)$_{3}$] Structure
comments:
(Ross, 1996) does not explicitly give the positions of the Al and Si atoms, which we take from (Downs, 2003). 
 (Ewald, 1937) orginally gave Ca$_3$Al$_2$(SiO$_{4}$)$_3$ garnet the {\em Strukturbericht} designation $H31$ or $H3_{1}$.  It was reclassified as a silicate and given the designation $S1_{4}$ by (Gottfried, 1937). 
 Although the original prototype was Ca$_3$Al$_2$(SiO$_{4}$)$_3$, we have better data for the isostructural Co$_3$Al$_2$(SiO$_{4}$)$_3$ and so use it as our example. 
 For pure ternary compounds, see \href{current_web_home_dir/A5B12C3_cI160_230_ad_h_c-001}{Y$_{3}$Al$_{5}$O$_{12}$ Garnet (YAG)}.
